intro: Mendoncia letestui, commonly known as the Letestu's mendoncia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant produces showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
